summary: The 'Providing Empathetic and Effective Recovery Support Act' (PEER Support Act) aims to address behavioral health workforce shortages by supporting peer support specialists. The bill defines peer support specialists, mandates the revision of the Standard Occupational Classification system to include the profession, establishes an Office of Recovery within the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration to oversee recovery support services, and mandates a report on criminal background check processes for peer support specialists to reduce potential barriers to certification.
